name: sprite touches sprite
content:
Triggers a sequence of blocks to run when a specific sprite touches another specific sprite.

(Opens YouTube in new tab)

[![How To Make A Sprite](https://img.youtube.com/vi/VUmZ2IsFAGo/0.jpg)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VUmZ2IsFAGo)

Sometimes code should only be run if an event happens. In this case, when a specific sprite touches another specific sprite, the blocks attached under the event block will begin to run sequentially. If the [`costume`(#df9399)](/docs/spritelab/gamelab_allSpritesWithAnimation/) block is used in either parameter, the event will check for touches between any sprites of the matching costume(s).

This block has a drop-down menu with “when” and “while” options. “When” a sprite touches another sprite, the code will only run once. “While” a sprite is touching another sprite, the code will run over and over again until the sprites stop touching.

examples.name: Example 1
examples.description: Whenever the bee touches the bear, the bear will say “Ouch!”

examples.name: Example 2
examples.description: While the bubble sprite is touching the soap sprite, it will grow bigger. When the bubble touches a rock sprite, it will “pop” and return to its original size.

palette_params.name: when/while
palette_params.description: Determines if the code is run when the sprite touches another sprite (runs once at a time) or continuously while the sprite is touching another sprite

palette_params.name: sprite
palette_params.description: The sprite or sprite group of the sprites touching

short_description: Triggers a sequence of blocks to run when a specific sprite touches another specific sprite.
tips: -  For group events, use the [`this / other sprite`(#df9399)](/docs/spritelab/gamelab_getThisSprite/) block in the following actions to only affect the sprite that was touched.
